sizeGuide.title: Size Guide
sizeGuide.intro: Finding the perfect fit is essential for comfort and style. Use our comprehensive size guide to ensure your HEVENTON blouse or shirt fits perfectly.

measurements.bustDescription: Measure around the fullest part of your bust
measurements.waistDescription: Measure around the narrowest part of your waist
measurements.hipsDescription: Measure around the fullest part of your hips
measurements.shoulderWidthDescription: Measure from shoulder seam to shoulder seam
measurements.chestDescription: Measure around the fullest part of your chest
measurements.neckDescription: Measure around the base of your neck
measurements.sleeveLengthDescription: Measure from shoulder to wrist with arm slightly bent

betweenSizes.title: Between Sizes?
betweenSizes.description: If you're between sizes, we recommend sizing up for a more comfortable fit, or sizing down for a more tailored look.

fabricStretch.title: Consider Fabric Stretch
fabricStretch.description: Some of our fabrics have natural stretch. Check the product description for fabric composition details.

shoulderFit.title: Shoulder Fit Matters
shoulderFit.description: The shoulder seam should sit right at your shoulder bone - not beyond or before it.

lengthConsiderations.title: Length Considerations
lengthConsiderations.description: Consider your height and preferred tucking style when choosing between regular and long lengths.

tooTight.title: Blouse/Shirt Too Tight Across Chest
tooTight.description: Try the next size up or look for styles with stretch fabric. The buttons should not pull or gap.

tooLoose.title: Blouse/Shirt Too Loose
tooLoose.description: Consider sizing down or try our fitted styles. A good fit should skim your body without being tight.

sleeveTooShort.title: Sleeves Too Short
sleeveTooShort.description: Look for long-sleeve options or styles specifically designed for taller frames.

gapingButtons.title: Button Gaping
gapingButtons.description: This often means the blouse is too small in the bust. Size up or try styles with stretch.

needHelp.title: Still Need Help?
needHelp.description: Our customer service team is here to help you find the perfect fit.

fabricCare.title: Fabric Care Guide
fabricCare.intro: Proper care extends the life of your garments and keeps them looking their best. Follow our expert guidance to maintain the quality and appearance of your HEVENTON pieces.

sortLaundry.title: Sort Your Laundry
sortLaundry.description: Separate whites, colors, and delicates to prevent color transfer and damage.

checkTemp.title: Check Temperature
checkTemp.description: Always follow the care label temperature recommendations for washing and ironing.

turnInside.title: Turn Inside Out
turnInside.description: Protect colors and prints by washing garments inside out.

mildDetergent.title: Use Mild Detergent
mildDetergent.description: Gentle, pH-neutral detergents protect fabric fibers and maintain color vibrancy.

avoidOverload.title: Don't Overload
avoidOverload.description: Give your garments room to move freely in the washer for effective cleaning.

airDry.title: Air Dry When Possible
airDry.description: Line drying is gentler on fabrics and better for the environment.

cotton.title: 100% Cotton
cotton.description: Natural, breathable, and durable. Cotton becomes stronger when wet but can shrink if not cared for properly.

washing.temp: Machine wash in warm water (30-40°C), hot for whites (60°C)
washing.cycle: Use normal cycle for sturdy items, gentle for delicates
washing.whites: For whites, use detergent with optical brighteners

drying.airDry: Preferably air dry on a hanger
drying.shape: Reshape while damp to maintain form

ironing.heat: High heat setting (cotton setting on iron)
ironing.damp: Iron while slightly damp for easier pressing

linen.title: Linen
linen.description: Lightweight and breathable with natural texture. Linen wrinkles easily but softens beautifully with wear.

washing.temp: Machine wash in cool to warm water (30°C)
washing.gentle: Use gentle cycle to prevent excessive wrinkling

drying.airDry: Air dry or tumble dry on low
drying.wrinkles: Remove while slightly damp to minimize wrinkles

ironing.highHeat: High heat while fabric is slightly damp

synthetic.title: Synthetic Blends (Polyester, Elastane)
synthetic.description: Easy care, wrinkle-resistant fabrics that often include stretch for comfort.

drying.hangDry: Or hang to dry to prevent static

ironing.cloth: Use pressing cloth to prevent shine

stainRemoval.title: Stain Removal Guide
stainRemoval.importantNote: Always treat stains as quickly as possible and test any stain removal method on an inconspicuous area first.

coffee.title: Coffee & Tea Stains
coffee.step3: Wash in coldest water safe for fabric

wine.title: Red Wine
wine.step2: Pour salt on stain to absorb
wine.step3: Rinse with cold water and wash normally

oil.title: Oil & Grease
oil.step1: Sprinkle with cornstarch or talcum powder
oil.step2: Let sit for 15 minutes to absorb oil
oil.step3: Brush off and apply dish soap, then wash

sweat.title: Sweat & Deodorant
sweat.step1: Mix equal parts water, hydrogen peroxide, and baking soda
sweat.step2: Apply to stain and let sit for 30 minutes

makeup.title: Makeup
makeup.step1: Apply makeup remover or dish soap to stain
makeup.step3: Rinse with warm water and wash

hanging.title: Hanging Storage
hanging.description: Best for most blouses and shirts:
hanging.tip1: Use padded or wooden hangers to maintain shape
hanging.tip2: Leave space between garments to prevent wrinkles
hanging.tip3: Button top button to help keep collar shape

folding.title: Folding Storage
folding.tip2: Store in drawers with adequate space
folding.tip3: Refold periodically to prevent permanent creases

seasonal.title: Seasonal Storage
seasonal.tip1: Clean before storing (stains set over time)
seasonal.tip3: Store in cool, dry place away from sunlight

symbols.title: Understanding Care Symbols
symbols.description: Care labels provide essential information about how to properly care for your garment.
symbols.bleachingDesc: Triangle indicates if bleach is safe
symbols.dryingDesc: Circle for tumble dry, square for line dry
symbols.ironingDesc: Iron symbol with dots showing heat level

professional.title: When to Use Professional Care
professional.reason2: Dealing with delicate fabrics like silk or wool blends
professional.reason3: Stubborn stains that home remedies can't remove

questions.title: Questions About Care?
questions.description: Our team is here to help with any fabric care questions.

hero.title: About HEVENTON
hero.subtitle: Quality blouses and shirts crafted with care, designed to stand the test of time.

story.title: Our Story
story.paragraph1: HEVENTON was founded with a simple mission: to provide high-quality, timeless blouses and shirts that make getting dressed a pleasure, not a chore.
story.paragraph2: We believe that everyone deserves clothing that fits well, feels comfortable, and lasts for years. That's why we focus exclusively on what we do best - creating exceptional blouses for women and quality shirts for men.
story.paragraph3: Every piece in our collection is carefully designed with attention to detail, using premium fabrics and expert craftsmanship. We're committed to offering styles that transcend trends, providing you with wardrobe essentials you'll reach for season after season.

quality.title: Quality First
quality.description: We never compromise on materials or construction. Every HEVENTON piece is made to last.

sustainability.title: Sustainable Practices
sustainability.description: We're committed to responsible sourcing and production methods that respect both people and planet.

timeless.title: Timeless Design
timeless.description: We create classic styles that won't go out of fashion, reducing waste and providing lasting value.

materials.title: Premium Materials
materials.point2: Long-staple cotton for superior softness and durability
materials.point3: Carefully selected fabric weights for optimal drape
materials.point4: Color-fast dyes that maintain vibrancy wash after wash

craftsmanship.title: Expert Craftsmanship
craftsmanship.point3: Quality buttons and closures that last

sourcing.title: Responsible Sourcing
sourcing.description: We work with suppliers who share our commitment to ethical practices and environmental responsibility.

production.title: Conscious Production
production.description: Our manufacturing partners meet strict standards for worker welfare and environmental impact.

packaging.title: Eco-Friendly Packaging

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about ordering, sizing, returns, and more.

q1.question: Do you offer free shipping?
q1.answer: Yes! We offer free shipping on all orders within Germany. For international orders, shipping costs are calculated at checkout based on your location.

q2.question: How long does delivery take?
q2.answer: Orders within Germany typically arrive within 2-4 business days. International shipping times vary by destination but generally range from 5-10 business days.

q3.question: Can I track my order?
q3.answer: Absolutely! Once your order ships, you'll receive a tracking number via email. You can also track your order status in your account dashboard.

q4.question: Do you ship internationally?
q4.answer: Yes, we ship to most countries worldwide. Shipping costs and delivery times vary by destination. All applicable customs fees and import duties are the responsibility of the customer.

q5.question: What if I need my order urgently?
q5.answer: For urgent orders, please contact our customer service team. We may be able to arrange express shipping for an additional fee, subject to availability.

q1.question: How do I find my correct size?
q1.answer: Visit our Size Guide for detailed measurement instructions and size charts. We provide both EU and international sizing conversions.

q2.question: What if I'm between sizes?
q2.answer: If you're between sizes, we generally recommend sizing up for a more comfortable fit. However, this can depend on your preferred style and the specific garment. Check the product description for fit notes.

q3.question: Do your sizes run true to size?
q3.answer: Yes, our sizes follow standard European sizing. We provide detailed measurements for each size in our size guide to help ensure the perfect fit.

q4.question: Can I exchange for a different size?
q4.answer: Yes! We offer free size exchanges within 30 days of purchase. Simply request an exchange through your account or contact our customer service team.

q5.question: Do you offer petite or tall sizes?
q5.answer: Currently, we offer our standard size range. However, we're working on expanding to include petite and tall options. Sign up for our newsletter to be notified when these become available.

q1.question: What is your return policy?
q1.answer: We offer a 30-day return policy from the date of delivery. Items must be unworn, unwashed, and in original condition with tags attached. Returns are free within Germany.

q2.question: How do I initiate a return?
q2.answer: Log into your account and navigate to your order history. Select the order you wish to return and click 'Request Return'. You'll receive a return label via email.

q3.question: When will I receive my refund?
q3.answer: Refunds are processed within 5-7 business days of receiving your return. The refund will be issued to your original payment method.

q4.question: Can I exchange instead of returning?
q4.answer: Yes! Exchanges are free and often faster than returns and repurchases. Select 'Exchange' when initiating your return to specify your preferred replacement.

q5.question: What if my item is defective?
q5.answer: We're sorry to hear that! Contact us immediately with photos of the defect. We'll arrange a free replacement or full refund, including return shipping costs.

q1.question: How should I care for my blouse/shirt?
q1.answer: Visit our Fabric Care Guide for detailed care instructions by fabric type. Generally, we recommend washing in cool water and air drying for longest life.

q2.question: Can I machine wash my HEVENTON items?
q2.answer: Yes, most of our items are machine washable. Always check the care label for specific instructions. We recommend using a gentle cycle and cool water.

q3.question: How do I remove stains?
q3.answer: Act quickly! Blot (don't rub) the stain and treat with appropriate stain remover. Our Stain Removal Guide provides detailed instructions for common stains.

q4.question: Will my white blouse yellow over time?
q4.answer: Proper care prevents yellowing. Wash whites separately, avoid fabric softener, and store in a cool, dry place. Our care guide includes tips for keeping whites bright.

q5.question: What makes HEVENTON quality different?
q5.answer: We use premium long-staple cotton, reinforced seams, and quality construction throughout. Every piece is designed to last for years with proper care. Learn more on our About page.

q1.question: What payment methods do you accept?
q1.answer: We accept all major credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express), PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, and bank transfer. All payments are processed securely.

q2.question: Is my payment information secure?
q2.answer: Absolutely. We use industry-standard SSL encryption and PCI-compliant payment processing. We never store your complete credit card information.

q3.question: When will I be charged?
q3.answer: Your payment method is charged when your order is confirmed and enters processing. For pre-orders, payment is taken when the item ships.

q4.question: Can I use multiple payment methods?
q4.answer: Currently, we accept one payment method per order. If you'd like to split payment, please place separate orders.

q5.question: Do you offer payment plans?
q5.answer: We currently don't offer payment plans directly, but you may be able to use services like PayPal Credit or Klarna if available in your region.

1.title: Perfect Fit and Quality!
1.text: I've been searching for the perfect white blouse for years, and this is it! The fabric is thick enough to not be see-through, the fit is flattering, and it holds up beautifully after multiple washes. Worth every penny!

2.title: Best Dress Shirt I Own
2.text: As someone who wears dress shirts daily, I can confidently say this is the highest quality shirt I've purchased. The cotton is substantial, the stitching is impeccable, and it doesn't wrinkle as easily as my other shirts.

3.title: Sustainable and Stylish
3.text: Love that HEVENTON uses sustainable materials without compromising on style. The blouse fits perfectly and I appreciate knowing exactly where it came from and how it was made.

4.title: Great Value
4.text: The quality is outstanding for the price. My only minor complaint is I wish there were more color options, but the classic white and blue are beautiful. Will definitely order more.

5.title: Customer Service Excellence
5.text: Not only is the blouse beautiful, but when I needed to exchange sizes, the process was seamless. Customer service was responsive and helpful. This is how online shopping should be!

6.title: A Wardrobe Staple
6.text: I now own three of these shirts in different colors. They're my go-to for both work and casual wear. The fit is consistent, quality is reliable, and they look great every time.

hero.title: Sustainability
hero.subtitle: Quality clothing that respects people and planet

commitment.title: Our Commitment
commitment.paragraph1: At HEVENTON, sustainability isn't just a buzzword—it's woven into everything we do. From the fibers we source to the factories we partner with, every decision is made with environmental and social responsibility in mind.
commitment.paragraph2: We believe that creating beautiful, long-lasting clothing and protecting our planet aren't mutually exclusive. In fact, they go hand in hand. By focusing on quality over quantity, using sustainable materials, and ensuring fair labor practices, we're building a business that can thrive for generations.
commitment.paragraph3: Transparency is key to our approach. We want you to know exactly where your clothes come from, how they're made, and the impact they have. This page details our commitments, achievements, and ongoing goals in our sustainability journey.

organic.title: Organic & Natural Fibers
organic.description: 100% of our cotton is organically grown without harmful pesticides or synthetic fertilizers

recycling.title: Waste Reduction
recycling.description: 95% of our production waste is recycled or upcycled into new products

manufacturing.title: Ethical Manufacturing
manufacturing.description: All partner factories are certified for fair wages and safe working conditions

fairTrade.title: Fair Trade Certified
fairTrade.description: Supporting farming communities through fair prices and sustainable practices

cotton.title: Organic Cotton
cotton.description: Our primary fabric is GOTS-certified organic cotton, grown without harmful chemicals.
cotton.point1: Uses 91% less water than conventional cotton

linen.title: European Linen
linen.description: We source linen from European flax, one of the most sustainable fibers available.
linen.point1: Requires minimal water and no irrigation
linen.point2: Every part of the flax plant is used

waterSaving.title: Water Conservation
waterSaving.description: Our partner factories use closed-loop water systems, reducing water consumption by 60%

energyEfficient.title: Renewable Energy
energyEfficient.description: 70% of our production facilities are powered by renewable energy sources

wasteReduction.title: Zero Waste Goals
wasteReduction.description: We're committed to achieving zero landfill waste from our production by 2027

packaging.title: Sustainable Packaging
packaging.point2: No plastic bags—we use compostable mailers
packaging.point3: Minimal packaging design to reduce waste

goal1.title: Carbon Neutral by 2027
goal1.description: Achieve carbon neutrality across our entire supply chain through emissions reduction and verified offset programs.

goal2.title: 100% Sustainable Materials by 2026
goal2.description: Ensure all materials used are either organic, recycled, or sustainably sourced with third-party certification.

goal3.title: Circular Economy Model by 2030
goal3.description: Implement a take-back program where customers can return worn items for recycling or upcycling into new products.

wardrobeEssentials.title: Wardrobe Essentials Guide
wardrobeEssentials.subtitle: Build a timeless wardrobe with these foundational pieces that work for any occasion.

item1.title: Classic White Blouse
item1.why: The most versatile piece you'll ever own. Dress it up for the office, down for weekends. Pairs with everything from jeans to pencil skirts.

item2.title: Black Silk-Blend Blouse
item2.why: Sophistication in a shirt. Perfect for client meetings, dinners, or any occasion requiring polish. The dark color hides stains and the fabric drapes beautifully.

item3.title: Neutral Button-Down
item3.why: Your go-to for effortless style. In beige, cream, or light gray, it's professional without being boring. Layers perfectly under blazers or cardigans.

item1.title: Tailored Fit Blouse
item1.why: Structure matters in professional settings. A well-fitted blouse shows attention to detail and projects confidence.

item2.title: French Cuff Dress Shirt
item2.why: For important meetings and presentations. Cufflinks add a touch of personality while maintaining professionalism.

item3.title: Classic Oxford Shirt
item3.why: The workhorse of your wardrobe. Crisp, clean, and appropriate for any office environment.

item1.title: Chambray Shirt
item1.why: Denim's sophisticated cousin. Casual enough for weekends but polished enough for casual Fridays.

item2.title: Linen Blend Blouse
item2.why: Summer essential. Breathable, relaxed, and effortlessly chic for warm weather.

item3.title: Striped Button-Down
item3.why: Pattern without risk. Stripes add visual interest while remaining classic and versatile.

item1.title: White Dress Shirt
item1.why: Non-negotiable. Every man needs at least two. Perfect for interviews, weddings, and any formal occasion.

item2.title: Light Blue Dress Shirt
item2.why: The second most important shirt. More interesting than white but just as versatile. Studies show it projects confidence.

item3.title: Classic Oxford Shirt
item3.why: The bridge between casual and formal. Can be worn with a suit or jeans, making it incredibly cost-per-wear efficient.

item1.title: Spread Collar Dress Shirt
item1.why: Modern and professional. The wider collar works with most tie knots and looks great without a tie.

item2.title: Non-Iron Business Shirt
item2.why: Time is money. These maintain a crisp look all day without the hassle of ironing.

item3.title: French Cuff Shirt
item3.why: For high-stakes meetings and client presentations. Shows you take the occasion seriously.

item1.title: Button-Down Oxford
item1.why: The weekend warrior. Preppy without trying too hard. Perfect with chinos or jeans.

item2.title: Chambray Shirt
item2.why: Your casual Friday MVP. Pairs perfectly with darker denim for the denim-on-denim look.

item3.title: Linen Shirt
item3.why: Summer essential. Yes, it wrinkles—that's part of the charm. Breathable and relaxed.

step1.title: Start with Neutrals
step1.description: Begin with white, light blue, and neutral colors. These form the foundation and maximize outfit combinations.

step2.title: Add One Pattern at a Time
step2.description: Once you have solid foundations, add stripes, checks, or subtle patterns. One new piece at a time ensures it integrates well.

step3.title: Invest in Quality
step3.description: Better to have 5 excellent shirts than 15 mediocre ones. Quality pieces last longer and always look better.

qualityOverQuantity.title: Why Quality Matters
qualityOverQuantity.description: A well-made shirt can last 5-10 years with proper care. Fast fashion shirts might last 6 months. The math is simple: quality is more economical and sustainable in the long run.

cta.title: Ready to Build Your Essential Wardrobe?
cta.description: Browse our curated collection of timeless pieces designed to last.

collarStyles.title: Complete Guide to Collar Styles
collarStyles.subtitle: Understanding collar styles helps you choose the perfect shirt or blouse for any occasion and face shape.

classic.title: Classic Point Collar
classic.description: The timeless choice. Pointed collar tips that frame the face beautifully. Works with or without accessories.
classic.bestFor: Office wear, professional settings, versatile everyday wear
classic.faceShape: Suits all face shapes, especially flattering for round faces

peterPan.title: Peter Pan Collar
peterPan.description: Soft, rounded collar that sits flat. Creates a feminine, vintage-inspired look.
peterPan.bestFor: Creative workplaces, casual settings, adding playful touch to outfits
peterPan.faceShape: Best for angular or square face shapes to soften features

bowTie.title: Bow Tie Collar
bowTie.description: Built-in bow at the neckline. Instantly elevates any look with romantic flair.
bowTie.bestFor: Special occasions, date nights, making a statement at work
bowTie.faceShape: Elongates round faces, adds interest to oval faces

mandarin.title: Mandarin Collar
mandarin.description: Stand-up collar without points. Clean, modern, and sophisticated.
mandarin.bestFor: Contemporary professional settings, minimalist style lovers
mandarin.faceShape: Elongates shorter necks, flattering for most face shapes

vNeck.title: V-Neck Collar
vNeck.description: Creates a V-shape at the neckline. Elongating and universally flattering.
vNeck.bestFor: Layering, casual Fridays, showing off delicate necklaces
vNeck.faceShape: Perfect for round or square faces, creates length

pussyBow.title: Pussy Bow
pussyBow.description: Long ties that create a soft bow. Feminine and vintage-inspired with modern appeal.
pussyBow.bestFor: Making a statement, professional settings, creative industries
pussyBow.faceShape: Adds volume, best for heart or oval face shapes

point.title: Point Collar
point.description: The classic standard. Collar points angled downward. The most versatile collar style.
point.bestFor: Professional men who want timeless style, works with or without tie
point.occasion: Office, business casual, any professional setting

spread.title: Spread Collar
spread.description: Wider collar points spread apart. Modern and sophisticated. Frames the tie knot beautifully.
spread.bestFor: Wider tie knots (Windsor, Half-Windsor), modern professional look
spread.occasion: Business meetings, formal events, when wearing a tie

buttonDown.title: Button-Down Collar
buttonDown.description: Collar points button to the shirt. Originated in polo, now a casual classic.
buttonDown.bestFor: Smart casual looks, tie-optional settings, preppy style
buttonDown.occasion: Casual Fridays, weekend wear, business casual environments

cutaway.title: Cutaway Collar
cutaway.description: Extremely wide spread, almost horizontal. Very modern and bold.
cutaway.bestFor: Large tie knots, contemporary professional style, making a statement
cutaway.occasion: High-profile meetings, formal events, fashion-forward offices

club.title: Club Collar
club.description: Rounded collar points instead of pointed. Vintage-inspired and distinctive.
club.bestFor: Standing out with sophisticated vintage style, creative professionals
club.occasion: Special occasions, creative workplaces, fashion events

band.title: Band Collar (Mandarin)
band.description: No collar points, just a standing band. Clean, modern, minimalist.
band.bestFor: Modern minimalists, tie-free professional looks, contemporary style
band.occasion: Smart casual, modern offices, creative industries

faceShapeGuide.title: Choosing Collars for Your Face Shape

round.title: Round Face
round.description: Choose collars that create vertical lines: point collars, V-necks, or mandarin collars. Avoid Peter Pan or rounded styles that emphasize roundness.

oval.title: Oval Face
oval.description: Lucky you! Most collar styles work beautifully with oval faces. Experiment with different styles based on personal preference and occasion.

square.title: Square Face
square.description: Soften angular features with rounded collars like Peter Pan, club, or spread collars. Avoid sharp, pointed collars that emphasize angles.

heart.title: Heart-Shaped Face
heart.description: Balance a wider forehead with wider collars: spread, cutaway, or pussy bow styles. These draw attention downward and create balance.

cta.title: Find Your Perfect Collar Style
cta.description: Explore our collection and discover which collar styles suit you best.

bodyTypeGuide.title: Body Type Guide - Find Your Perfect Fit
bodyTypeGuide.subtitle: Understanding your body type helps you choose shirts and blouses that flatter your unique shape. Find your fit below.

pear.title: Pear Shape
pear.description: Narrower shoulders and bust, wider hips and thighs
pear.best1: Boat neck blouses that widen shoulders
pear.best3: Bright colors and patterns on top
pear.avoid1: Blouses that end at widest part of hips
pear.avoid2: Tight-fitting styles that emphasize bottom half

apple.title: Apple Shape
apple.description: Fuller midsection, shapely legs, narrower hips
apple.best3: Flowing fabrics that skim the midsection

hourglass.title: Hourglass Shape
hourglass.description: Balanced bust and hips with defined waist
hourglass.best1: Fitted styles that show your waist
hourglass.avoid2: Overly loose fits that hide your curves

rectangle.title: Rectangle Shape
rectangle.description: Shoulders, waist, and hips are similar width
rectangle.best1: Peplum styles that create waist definition
rectangle.best2: Ruffles and details that add curves
rectangle.avoid2: Styles that make you look too linear

invertedTriangle.title: Inverted Triangle
invertedTriangle.best2: Dark colors on top, lighter on bottom

petite.title: Petite
petite.avoid2: Long tunics that shorten your legs

athletic.title: Athletic Build
athletic.description: Broad shoulders, defined chest, narrow waist
athletic.best2: Stretch fabrics for comfort and movement
athletic.best3: Tapered waist to highlight your V-shape
athletic.avoid1: Boxy, loose fits that hide your physique
athletic.avoid2: Shirts that are too tight in chest/arms

slim.title: Slim Build
slim.avoid1: Extra slim fits that emphasize thinness
slim.avoid2: Baggy shirts that make you look smaller

stocky.title: Stocky Build
stocky.best1: Regular fit with room in chest
stocky.avoid1: Slim fits that pull across chest

broadShoulders.title: Broad Shoulders
broadShoulders.description: Wide shoulder width, athletic upper body

tallLean.title: Tall & Lean
tallLean.best2: Fitted styles to avoid looking lanky
tallLean.avoid1: Regular lengths that look too short

short.title: Short Stature
short.avoid1: Long tails that shorten your legs

tip1.title: Shoulder Seam is Key
tip1.description: The shoulder seam should hit exactly at your shoulder point. Too wide or narrow throws off the entire fit.

tip2.title: Collar Comfort
tip2.description: You should fit two fingers comfortably between your neck and a buttoned collar. Any tighter is uncomfortable.

tip3.title: Movement Test
tip3.description: Raise your arms, sit down, move around. A well-fitted shirt allows full movement without pulling or gaping.

cta.title: Find Your Perfect Fit
cta.description: Browse our collection and discover styles made for your body type.

colorGuide.title: Color Matching Guide
colorGuide.subtitle: Master the art of color coordination. Learn which colors work together and which shades complement your skin tone.

neutrals.title: Neutral Colors
neutrals.description: The foundation of any wardrobe. Mix with anything.

warm.title: Warm Colors
warm.description: Colors with red, orange, or yellow undertones.

cool.title: Cool Colors
cool.description: Colors with blue, green, or purple undertones.

classic.title: Timeless Classics
classic.desc1: The most versatile combination. Always sophisticated.
classic.desc2: Professional and polished. Perfect for business.

bold.title: Bold Combinations
bold.desc1: Rich and sophisticated. Great for fall/winter.
bold.desc2: Earthy and refined. Perfect for casual settings.
bold.desc3: Creative yet professional. Stand out tastefully.

skinTone.title: Colors for Your Skin Tone
skinTone.description: Choosing colors that complement your skin tone makes you look healthier, more vibrant, and more polished.

warm.title: Warm Skin Tones
warm.description: Gold jewelry looks better than silver. Veins appear greenish.

cool.title: Cool Skin Tones
cool.description: Silver jewelry looks better than gold. Veins appear bluish.

neutral.title: Neutral Skin Tones
neutral.description: Both gold and silver jewelry look good. Lucky you!
neutral.tip: Experiment freely! You have the most flexibility in color choices.

conservative.title: Conservative Industries
conservative.description: Finance, law, corporate: stick to classic neutrals

creative.title: Creative Industries
creative.description: Tech, design, media: express personality with color

do.title: Do
do.tip1: Match one color from the pattern to your bottoms
do.tip2: Keep patterns in the same color family

dont.title: Don't
dont.tip1: Mix more than 2 patterns in one outfit
dont.tip2: Combine patterns of the same size/scale
dont.tip3: Clash warm and cool patterns together

cta.title: Explore Our Color Collection
cta.description: Shop our curated selection of colors perfect for every occasion.

fabricEncyclopedia.title: Complete Fabric Encyclopedia
fabricEncyclopedia.subtitle: Understanding fabric types helps you choose the right shirt or blouse for any occasion. Learn about materials, care, and best uses.

cotton.title: Cotton
cotton.description: The most popular natural fiber. Soft, breathable, and versatile. From casual to formal, cotton works for everything.
cotton.pro4: Easy to care for and affordable
cotton.care: Machine wash cold, tumble dry low. Iron while slightly damp for best results.

linen.title: Linen
linen.description: Made from flax plant fibers. The ultimate summer fabric—incredibly breathable but wrinkles are part of its charm.
linen.care: Machine wash cold, line dry preferred. Embrace the wrinkles or iron while damp.

silk.title: Silk
silk.description: Luxurious protein fiber from silkworm cocoons. Incredibly soft, naturally temperature-regulating, and undeniably elegant.
silk.pro4: Takes dye beautifully for rich colors
silk.care: Dry clean preferred or hand wash in cold water with silk-safe detergent. Never wring.

polyester.title: Polyester
polyester.description: Man-made fiber that's wrinkle-resistant and durable. Often blended with natural fibers for easy-care performance.
polyester.con2: Can feel less comfortable in heat
polyester.care: Machine wash warm, tumble dry low. Easy care.

modal.title: Modal / Rayon
modal.description: Semi-synthetic fiber made from beech tree cellulose. Combines the best of natural and synthetic—soft, breathable, and drapes beautifully.
modal.care: Machine wash cold on gentle cycle, hang dry or tumble dry low.

blends.title: Fabric Blends
blends.description: Combining fibers creates fabrics with the best properties of each. These are some of the most practical options.

cottonPoly.title: Cotton-Polyester Blend
cottonPoly.description: Usually 60% cotton, 40% polyester. The cotton provides breathability, the polyester adds wrinkle-resistance.
cottonPoly.bestFor: Work shirts, travel, low-maintenance wardrobe essentials

cottonSilk.title: Cotton-Silk Blend
cottonSilk.description: Combines cotton's comfort with silk's sheen and drape. More affordable than pure silk, easier to care for.
cottonSilk.bestFor: Special occasion blouses, elevated casual wear

linenCotton.title: Linen-Cotton Blend
linenCotton.description: The breathability of linen with cotton's softness and reduced wrinkling. Best of both worlds for summer.
linenCotton.bestFor: Summer shirts, vacation wear, smart casual

stretch.title: Stretch Blends (with Elastane/Spandex)
stretch.description: Adding 2-5% stretch fiber to any fabric improves comfort and fit. Moves with you without losing shape.
stretch.bestFor: Active lifestyles, fitted styles, all-day comfort

sustainability.title: Sustainable Fabric Choices
sustainability.description: Not all fabrics are created equal when it comes to environmental impact. Here's what to look for:

organic.title: Organic Cotton
organic.description: Grown without pesticides or synthetic fertilizers. Better for the environment and farmers.

recycled.title: Recycled Polyester
recycled.description: Made from recycled plastic bottles. Reduces waste and uses less energy than virgin polyester.

lowImpact.title: Low-Impact Dyes
lowImpact.description: Traditional dyeing uses lots of water and chemicals. Low-impact dyes reduce environmental harm.

cta.title: Shop by Fabric Type
cta.description: Filter our collection by fabric to find exactly what you need.

howToMeasure.title: How to Measure Yourself
howToMeasure.subtitle: Get the perfect fit every time with accurate measurements. Follow our step-by-step guide for both men and women.

bust.title: Bust Measurement
bust.step1: Wear a non-padded bra for accurate measurement
bust.step2: Wrap tape around the fullest part of your bust, keeping tape parallel to floor
bust.step3: The tape should be snug but not tight. You should be able to breathe comfortably
bust.tip: Don't pull the tape too tight—this is the most common mistake that leads to ordering too small.

waist.title: Waist Measurement
waist.step1: Find your natural waist (narrowest point, usually 1-2 inches above belly button)
waist.step2: Wrap tape around your waist, keeping it level all around
waist.step3: Breathe normally and take measurement at the end of a natural exhale
waist.tip: Don't suck in! Measure your natural waist for accurate fit.

shoulder.title: Shoulder Width
shoulder.step2: Measure from the edge of one shoulder to the edge of the other, across your back
shoulder.step3: The measurement should cross the top of your shoulders where they naturally slope
shoulder.tip: This is easier with a helper. If alone, measure a well-fitting shirt's shoulder width instead.

sleeve.title: Sleeve Length
sleeve.step1: Bend your elbow 90 degrees and place hand on hip
sleeve.step2: Measure from the center back of neck, over the shoulder, down to the wrist bone
sleeve.step3: The tape should follow the curve of your bent arm
sleeve.tip: Sleeve length varies by style. This measurement works best for long-sleeve shirts.

neck.title: Neck Size
neck.step2: Wrap tape around the base of your neck where a collar would sit
neck.step3: You should fit two fingers comfortably between your neck and the tape
neck.tip: This determines your collar size. Add 0.5 inch for comfort—you don't want it too tight.

chest.title: Chest Measurement
chest.step1: Breathe normally and stand with arms at sides
chest.step2: Wrap tape around the fullest part of your chest (usually nipple level)
chest.step3: Keep tape parallel to floor and ensure it's not too tight
chest.tip: For athletic builds, measure with arms slightly away from body to account for movement.

waist.title: Waist Measurement
waist.step1: Measure where you naturally wear your pants (not your natural waist)
waist.step2: Wrap tape around this point, keeping it level
waist.step3: Don't suck in—measure your real waist for accurate fit
waist.tip: Men's shirts use chest size primarily, but waist measurement helps with fit preference.

sleeve.title: Sleeve Length
sleeve.step1: Stand with arm relaxed at side, slightly bent
sleeve.step2: Measure from center back of neck, over shoulder, down arm to wrist bone
sleeve.step3: The measurement should follow your arm's natural position
sleeve.tip: Alternatively, measure from shoulder seam to where you want cuff to end (at wrist bone).

mistake1.title: Pulling Tape Too Tight
mistake1.description: The tape should be snug but not compressing. Too tight means you'll order too small.

mistake2.title: Measuring Over Bulky Clothes
mistake2.description: Always measure over fitted clothing or directly on skin for accuracy.

mistake3.title: Not Standing Naturally
mistake3.description: Don't suck in, puff out chest, or stand differently than normal. Natural posture = accurate measurements.

mistake4.title: Uneven Tape Position
mistake4.description: Keep the tape parallel to the floor. Check in mirror to ensure it's not slanted.

tip1.title: Measure in the Morning
tip1.description: Your body can fluctuate throughout the day. Morning measurements tend to be most consistent.

tip2.title: Get Help When Possible
tip2.description: A second person can ensure the tape stays level and positioned correctly, especially for shoulder and sleeve measurements.

tip3.title: Compare to a Favorite Shirt
tip3.description: Lay flat a shirt that fits you perfectly and measure it. Compare these measurements to our size charts.

cta.title: Ready to Find Your Perfect Fit?
cta.description: Use your measurements with our detailed size charts.

officeDressCode.title: Office Dress Code Guide
officeDressCode.subtitle: Navigate any workplace with confidence. Learn what to wear for every office environment, from business formal to smart casual.

businessFormal.title: Business Formal
businessFormal.when: Law firms, finance, C-suite meetings, court appearances

women.item1: Tailored blouse in white, ivory, or light blue

men.item1: White or light blue dress shirt

businessFormal.tip: This is the most formal dress code. When in doubt, overdress rather than underdress.

businessProfessional.title: Business Professional
businessProfessional.tip: More flexible than business formal, but still polished and traditional.

businessCasual.title: Business Casual
businessCasual.when: Most modern offices, tech companies, creative agencies

women.item2: Dress pants, chinos, or knee-length skirt

businessCasual.tip: No jeans (usually), no sneakers. Still professional but more relaxed.

smartCasual.title: Smart Casual

men.item4: Clean sneakers or casual leather shoes

smartCasual.tip: More personality allowed. Still neat and put-together, just less formal.

byIndustry.title: Dress Codes by Industry
byIndustry.description: Different industries have different expectations. Here's what to expect in the most common fields.

finance.title: Finance & Banking
finance.description: Conservative, traditional. Stick to classic colors and minimal accessories. First impressions matter enormously.

law.title: Law
law.description: The most formal industry. Dark suits, white shirts, conservative ties. Courtroom appearances require formal business attire.

tech.title: Tech & Startups
tech.description: Generally the most relaxed. Many allow jeans and sneakers. When meeting investors or clients, dress up one level.

creative.title: Creative Industries
creative.description: Design, advertising, media. More freedom to express personal style. Clean, intentional looks still matter.

healthcare.title: Healthcare (Admin)
healthcare.description: Clinical staff wear scrubs, but administrative roles typically require business casual attire.

education.title: Education
education.description: Neat and professional. You're setting an example. Avoid anything too casual or revealing.

mistake1.title: Assuming Friday = Casual Everywhere
mistake1.description: Casual Friday varies wildly by company. Some mean jeans, others just mean no tie. Ask first.

mistake2.title: Dressing for Your Current Job, Not the One You Want
mistake2.description: If you want to be promoted, observe and match how leadership dresses.

mistake3.title: Ignoring Company Culture
mistake3.description: The handbook might say business casual, but if everyone wears suits, you should too.

mistake4.title: Overdressing for Creative Fields
mistake4.description: In some industries, wearing a suit when everyone's in hoodies signals you don't fit the culture.

tip1.title: Observe First
tip1.description: Your first week, pay attention to what everyone wears. When do people dress up? When do they dress down?

tip2.title: Dress for Your Next Meeting
tip2.description: Have a client meeting or presentation? Dress one level up from your normal office attire.

tip3.title: Keep a Spare
tip3.description: Keep a blazer and dress shoes at the office for unexpected meetings or events.

cta.title: Build Your Professional Wardrobe
cta.description: Shop our collection of office-appropriate shirts and blouses.

travelWardrobe.title: Travel Wardrobe Guide
travelWardrobe.subtitle: Pack smart, travel light, and look great anywhere. Master the capsule wardrobe for business and leisure travel.

packingRule.title: The 5-4-3-2-1 Packing Rule
packingRule.description: This classic packing formula works for a week-long trip and ensures maximum outfit combinations with minimum luggage.

tops.title: Tops
tops.description: Mix of blouses/shirts for different occasions

bottoms.title: Bottoms
bottoms.description: Pants, skirts, or shorts in coordinating colors

shoes.title: Pairs of Shoes
shoes.description: Walking shoes, dress shoes, casual shoes

businessTravel.title: Business Travel Capsule
businessTravel.description: Pack professional pieces that resist wrinkles and mix-and-match for maximum versatility.

women.title: Women's Business Travel
women.why: 5 tops × 3 bottoms = 15 outfit combinations. Stick to black, navy, gray, white for easy mixing.

men.title: Men's Business Travel
men.why: Neutral colors ensure everything matches. Non-iron fabrics save time and hassle.

leisureTravel.title: Leisure Travel Capsule
leisureTravel.description: Comfortable, stylish pieces for sightseeing, dining, and relaxing.

women.title: Women's Vacation Wardrobe
women.why: Breathable fabrics, easy to wash, comfortable for all-day wear.

men.title: Men's Vacation Wardrobe
men.why: Versatile pieces work for dinner out or daytime exploring. Easy to layer for different climates.

tip1.title: Choose a Color Palette
tip1.description: Pick 2-3 neutral base colors and 1-2 accent colors. Everything should coordinate.

tip2.title: Roll, Don't Fold
tip2.description: Rolling clothes saves space and reduces wrinkles. Use packing cubes for organization.

tip3.title: Wear Bulkiest Items
tip3.description: Wear your heaviest shoes and jacket on the plane to save luggage space.

tip4.title: Plan Your Outfits
tip4.description: Take a photo of each outfit before packing. Ensures you have complete looks.

tip5.title: Pack Versatile Pieces
tip5.description: Every item should work for at least 2 different outfits.

tip6.title: Leave Room for Shopping
tip6.description: Pack slightly under capacity to bring home souvenirs or purchases.

method1.title: Choose Wrinkle-Resistant Fabrics
method1.description: Cotton-polyester blends, jersey knits, and technical fabrics resist wrinkles better than 100% cotton or linen.

method2.title: Use Tissue Paper
method2.description: Layer tissue paper between folded garments to reduce friction and creasing.

method3.title: Hang Immediately
method3.description: Unpack and hang everything as soon as you arrive. Steam from a hot shower can release minor wrinkles.

method4.title: Travel Steamer
method4.description: A compact travel steamer is worth the luggage space for crisp, professional looks.

cta.title: Shop Travel-Friendly Pieces
cta.description: Browse wrinkle-resistant, packable shirts and blouses perfect for travel.

tuckingGuide.title: The Complete Shirt Tucking Guide
tuckingGuide.subtitle: Learn when to tuck, when not to tuck, and master four different tucking techniques for every occasion.

whenToTuck.title: When to Tuck vs. When to Leave Untucked

situation1.title: With a Belt
situation1.description: If you're wearing a belt, your shirt should be tucked. An untucked shirt hides the belt, making it pointless.

situation2.title: Dress Shirts
situation2.description: Traditional dress shirts with long tails and stiff collars are designed to be tucked.

situation3.title: Formal Occasions
situation3.description: Weddings, job interviews, court, formal dinners—these all require tucked shirts.

situation4.title: Business Professional Settings
situation4.description: In conservative office environments, always tuck your shirt.

situation1.title: Short, Straight-Hem Shirts
situation1.description: If a shirt has a straight bottom hem (not curved), it's designed to be worn untucked.

situation2.title: Casual T-Shirts
situation2.description: Unless you're going for a very specific retro look, don't tuck t-shirts.

situation3.title: Oversized or Boxy Fits
situation3.description: Modern oversized styles look best untucked. Tucking ruins the intended silhouette.

situation4.title: Very Short Torsos
situation4.description: If tucking makes your legs look extremely short, leave it untucked and use other styling tricks.

fullTuck.title: Full Tuck (Classic)
fullTuck.description: The traditional, complete tuck. All of your shirt is tucked in all around. This is the standard for formal and business settings.
fullTuck.step1: Put on your pants but don't button them yet
fullTuck.step2: Tuck your entire shirt in all the way around
fullTuck.step4: Adjust the fabric to remove bunching. Pull the shirt tight from the back for a smooth front

halfTuck.title: Half Tuck (French Tuck)
halfTuck.description: Made famous by Tan France on Queer Eye. Only the front center portion is tucked in. Casual and fashion-forward.
halfTuck.step2: Take just the front center section (about 4-6 inches wide)
halfTuck.step3: Tuck only that section into the front of your pants
halfTuck.step4: Adjust so it looks intentional, not messy. The rest stays out

frontTuck.title: Front Tuck
frontTuck.description: The entire front of the shirt is tucked in, while the back remains out. More coverage than a half-tuck but still casual.
frontTuck.step2: Tuck the entire front of your shirt into your pants
frontTuck.step3: Leave the back and sides completely untucked
frontTuck.step4: Smooth the front and adjust the back so it drapes nicely

militaryTuck.title: Military Tuck (Shirt Garters)
militaryTuck.description: The most secure tuck. Creates sharp, wrinkle-free lines that stay in place all day. Used by military and those wanting perfection.
militaryTuck.step1: Do a full tuck as normal
militaryTuck.step2: Pull excess fabric at the sides toward the back
militaryTuck.step3: Pinch the excess fabric and fold it flat against your body
militaryTuck.step4: The fold should create a clean, flat front with fabric pinched at your hips
militaryTuck.step5: Use shirt stays or tuck the folded fabric into your underwear waistband to secure

tall.title: Tall & Lean
tall.description: Full tucks work great. They create definition and show off your height. Avoid half-tucks which can make you look boxy.

petite.title: Petite or Short Torso
petite.description: Tucking can shorten your legs further. Try a half-tuck to define waist without full commitment, or choose shorter shirts to wear untucked.

athletic.title: Athletic or Broad
athletic.description: Military tuck creates the cleanest line. Full tucks work well. Avoid leaving shirts untucked as they can add bulk.

mistake1.title: Too Much Fabric
mistake1.description: If your shirt bunches and billows, it's too big. Consider tailoring or sizing down.

mistake2.title: Tucking Without a Belt
mistake2.description: A full tuck without a belt looks unfinished. Always wear a belt with a full tuck.

mistake3.title: Uneven Tuck
mistake3.description: Your shirt should be evenly distributed. Check the back in a mirror—most bunching happens there.

mistake4.title: Wrong Shirt Type
mistake4.description: Don't fight the design. Straight-hem casual shirts shouldn't be tucked. Long dress shirt tails shouldn't be left out.

cta.title: Find the Perfect Tuckable Shirt
cta.description: Shop shirts designed for the perfect tuck, every time.

accessorizingGuide.title: The Complete Accessorizing Guide
accessorizingGuide.subtitle: Master the art of accessories. Learn how to elevate your shirts and blouses with jewelry, ties, scarves, and more.

rule1.title: Less is More
rule1.description: Don't wear every accessory you own at once. Choose 2-3 focal points maximum.

rule2.title: Match Your Metals
rule2.description: Stick to one metal color (gold OR silver) across all accessories for a cohesive look.

rule3.title: Balance is Key
rule3.description: If your shirt is busy, keep accessories simple. If your shirt is plain, accessories can be bold.

necklaces.title: Necklaces
necklaces.item1: V-neck blouses: Pair with a pendant that follows the V-line
necklaces.item2: Crew neck: Chokers or short necklaces work best
necklaces.item3: Button-down: Leave top 2 buttons open, add a longer necklace
necklaces.item4: High neck: Skip the necklace, focus on earrings

earrings.title: Earrings
earrings.item1: Short hair or updo: Statement earrings shine
earrings.item2: Long hair: Keep earrings smaller or they get lost
earrings.item3: Bold necklace: Studs or small hoops balance better

silk.title: Silk Scarf
silk.description: Tie at the neck for Parisian chic or wear as a headband. Perfect for adding color to neutral blouses.

statement.title: Statement Scarf
statement.description: Large, bold patterns work best with solid-color blouses. Can double as a shawl.

neutral.title: Neutral Scarf
neutral.description: Beige, gray, black scarves complement patterned blouses without competing.

belts.title: Belts
belts.item1: Match belt to shoes for a polished look
belts.item2: Thin belts for tucked blouses, thicker for over-blouse
belts.item3: Statement buckles can replace a necklace as focal point

bags.title: Bags
bags.item1: Bag doesn't have to match shoes exactly, but should complement
bags.item3: Color can introduce a pop to neutral outfits

choosing.title: Choosing a Tie
choosing.item1: Solid shirt: Patterned tie works great
choosing.item2: Patterned shirt: Solid tie or small repeating pattern
choosing.item3: Tie should be darker than your shirt
choosing.item4: Tip should reach your belt buckle (not longer or shorter)

formal.title: Formal Occasions
formal.description: Thin, simple watch with leather band. Metal should match your belt buckle and ring (if worn).

business.title: Business Settings
business.description: Classic watch, leather or metal band. Not too flashy. Dial should be easy to read.

casual.title: Casual Wear
casual.description: Sport watches, smart watches, or colorful straps acceptable. More freedom for personal style.

pocketSquares.title: Pocket Squares
pocketSquares.item1: Should complement tie, not match exactly
pocketSquares.item2: White linen is always appropriate for formal
pocketSquares.item3: Colored silk adds personality to business attire

cufflinks.title: Cufflinks
cufflinks.item2: Match watch metal (silver with silver, gold with gold)
cufflinks.item3: Simple and classic for business, fun designs for social

belts.title: Belts
belts.item1: Always match belt to shoes (black belt = black shoes)
belts.item2: Belt buckle metal should match watch/jewelry
belts.item3: Width should match pant loops (usually 1.25-1.5 inches)

metalCoordination.title: Coordinating Metals
metalCoordination.description: Mixing gold and silver can look messy. Choose one metal family and stick with it throughout your accessories.

gold.title: Gold Tones
gold.description: Warm, luxurious, traditional. Best for warm skin tones.
gold.pairWith: Brown leather, warm colors (burgundy, rust, olive), tortoiseshell

silver.title: Silver/Cool Tones
silver.description: Modern, clean, versatile. Best for cool skin tones.
silver.pairWith: Black leather, cool colors (navy, gray, black), silver hardware

mistake1.title: Over-Accessorizing
mistake1.description: Wearing too many statement pieces at once. Choose one focal point—earrings OR necklace, not both as statement pieces.

mistake2.title: Mismatched Metals
mistake2.description: Gold watch + silver belt buckle + mixed jewelry looks disorganized. Pick one metal and commit.

mistake3.title: Wrong Proportion
mistake3.description: Tiny accessories on a large frame or chunky accessories on a petite frame throw off balance.

mistake4.title: Ignoring Shirt Color
mistake4.description: Silver jewelry disappears on a gray shirt. Gold can clash with cool-toned blouses. Consider contrast.

mistake5.title: Tie Too Short or Long
mistake5.description: Tie tip should hit your belt buckle. Any shorter or longer looks sloppy.

mistake6.title: Forgetting to Remove Tags
mistake6.description: Check your cufflinks, tie, scarf, and watch. Stickers and tags happen to everyone.

cta.title: Complete Your Look
cta.description: Browse our shirts and blouses designed to pair perfectly with your favorite accessories.

stainRemoval.title: Emergency Stain Removal Guide
stainRemoval.subtitle: Quick action can save your favorite shirt or blouse. Learn professional techniques to tackle common stains before they set permanently.

goldenRules.title: The 3 Golden Rules of Stain Removal

rule1.title: Act Fast
rule1.description: The first 5 minutes are critical. Fresh stains are 10x easier to remove than set-in stains.

rule2.title: Never Rub
rule2.description: Always blot from the outside in. Rubbing spreads the stain and damages fabric fibers.

rule3.title: Test First
rule3.description: Always test cleaning solutions on an inconspicuous area first to prevent discoloration or damage.

coffee.title: Coffee & Tea Stains
coffee.step1: Blot immediately with a clean, dry cloth
coffee.step2: Run cold water through the back of the stain
coffee.step3: Apply liquid laundry detergent and let sit for 5 minutes
coffee.solution: Mix 1 tablespoon white vinegar + 1 tablespoon dish soap + 2 cups warm water. Blot with solution, then rinse.

wine.title: Red Wine Stains
wine.step1: Cover immediately with salt to absorb the wine
wine.step2: After 5 minutes, gently scrape off the salt
wine.step3: Rinse with cold water from the back of the fabric
wine.solution: Pour boiling water from a height of 12 inches onto the stain, or use club soda to lift the stain.

oil.title: Oil & Grease Stains
oil.step1: Do NOT wet the stain - oil and water don't mix
oil.step2: Sprinkle cornstarch or baby powder on the stain
oil.step3: Let it sit for 30 minutes to absorb the oil
oil.solution: Apply dish soap (Dawn works best) directly to dry stain. Rub gently, then wash in hottest water fabric allows.

ink.title: Ink Stains
ink.step1: Place a paper towel under the stain to absorb excess
ink.step2: Dab (don't rub) with rubbing alcohol using a cotton ball
ink.step3: Continue until no more ink transfers to the cotton ball
ink.solution: For ballpoint ink: rubbing alcohol. For gel ink: use hand sanitizer. For permanent marker: try hairspray.

sweat.title: Sweat & Deodorant Stains
sweat.step1: Turn garment inside out to access the actual sweat stain
sweat.step2: Pre-treat with a paste of baking soda and water
sweat.step3: Let sit for 1 hour before washing
sweat.solution: Mix 4 tablespoons baking soda + 1/4 cup white vinegar + 1/4 cup water. Apply to stain, scrub gently, rinse after 30 minutes.

blood.title: Blood Stains
blood.step1: ALWAYS use cold water (hot water sets blood stains permanently)
blood.step2: Rinse immediately under cold running water
blood.step3: Soak in cold salt water for 30 minutes
blood.solution: For stubborn blood: apply hydrogen peroxide directly to stain. It will bubble - let it work, then rinse with cold water.

emergencyKit.title: Build Your Emergency Stain Kit
emergencyKit.description: Keep these essentials on hand for quick stain response at home and on the go:

mistake1.title: Don't Use Hot Water on Unknown Stains
mistake1.description: Hot water can permanently set protein-based stains like blood, sweat, and dairy. Always start with cold water.

mistake2.title: Don't Put It in the Dryer
mistake2.description: Heat from the dryer will permanently set any remaining stain. Air dry until you're certain the stain is gone.

mistake3.title: Don't Mix Random Chemicals
mistake3.description: Mixing bleach with ammonia or vinegar creates toxic fumes. Stick to one proven method at a time.

mistake4.title: Don't Give Up Too Soon
mistake4.description: Some stains require multiple treatments. If the first attempt doesn't work completely, try again before giving up.

cta.title: Stain-Resistant Fabrics
cta.description: Explore our collection of easy-care shirts and blouses that resist stains and stay looking fresh.

ironingSteaming.title: Ironing & Steaming Guide
ironingSteaming.subtitle: Master the art of wrinkle-free shirts and blouses. Learn when to iron, when to steam, and the professional techniques for crisp, polished results.

comparison.title: Iron vs. Steam: Which Should You Use?

ironing.title: Ironing
ironing.pro1: Gives the sharpest, most professional finish
ironing.con1: Can damage delicate fabrics if too hot
ironing.con2: Requires ironing board and more time

step1.title: Start with the Collar
step1.description: Iron from the points toward the center on both sides. Work from the underside first, then flip and press the top.

step2.title: Move to the Cuffs
step2.description: Unbutton and lay flat. Iron the inside first, then the outside. Pay special attention to button areas.

step3.title: Iron the Sleeves
step3.description: Lay sleeve flat with seam aligned. Iron from shoulder to cuff in smooth strokes. Avoid creasing the top of the sleeve.

step4.title: Press the Back Panel
step4.description: Drape over the ironing board. Start from one side, iron across to the other in sections. Include the yoke.

step5.title: Finish with the Front Panels
step5.description: Iron around buttons (never over them). Use the iron's tip for tight spaces. Work from top to bottom.

hanging.title: Hanging Method
hanging.step1: Hang garment on a sturdy hanger
hanging.step2: Fill steamer with distilled water (prevents mineral buildup)
hanging.step3: Hold steamer head close but not touching fabric
hanging.step4: Work from top to bottom in vertical motions
hanging.step5: Pull fabric taut with free hand for best results

tips.title: Pro Steaming Tips
tips.tip1: Steam from the inside for delicate fabrics
tips.tip2: Let garment dry for 5-10 minutes after steaming
tips.tip3: Use gentle downward motions - never horizontal
tips.tip4: For stubborn wrinkles, steam the same area multiple times

tip1.title: Use Distilled Water
tip1.description: Tap water minerals can clog your iron or leave marks on fabric. Distilled water keeps your equipment clean and your shirts spotless.

tip2.title: Iron Inside Out for Dark Colors
tip2.description: This prevents shine marks on dark fabrics and protects prints or embellishments from direct heat damage.

tip3.title: Try the Ice Cube Trick
tip3.description: Toss a few ice cubes in the dryer with wrinkled shirts for 10 minutes. The steam created will release minor wrinkles without ironing.

tip4.title: Hang Immediately After Shower
tip4.description: Bathroom steam can release wrinkles from hanging garments. Perfect for travel when you don't have an iron.

tip5.title: Focus on What Shows
tip5.description: No one sees the back. In a time crunch, prioritize collar, cuffs, and front panels - the parts people actually notice.

tip6.title: Iron When Slightly Damp
tip6.description: Slightly damp fabric irons more easily and gets crisper results. Remove from dryer while still a bit damp, or use spray bottle.

cta.title: Wrinkle-Resistant Styles
cta.description: Discover our collection of wrinkle-resistant fabrics that look great with minimal effort.

virtualMeeting.title: Virtual Meeting Style Guide
virtualMeeting.subtitle: Look professional and polished on camera. Master the art of video call styling with colors, patterns, and setups that make you look your best.

cameraFrame.title: The Camera Frame Rule
cameraFrame.description: What works in person doesn't always work on camera. Follow these rules for the most flattering video appearance.

rule1.title: Frame from Chest Up
rule1.description: Position your camera to show from mid-chest to just above your head. This is the most natural and professional framing.

rule2.title: What Matters Most
rule2.description: Focus your effort on what the camera sees: collar area, top buttons, and accessories in the upper third of frame.

rule3.title: Background Contrast
rule3.description: Your outfit should contrast with your background. Light background = darker shirt, dark background = lighter shirt.

blue.title: Blue Tones
blue.description: Navy, royal blue, and teal look professional and work with all skin tones on camera.

purple.title: Purple & Plum
purple.description: Sophisticated and memorable without being overpowering. Great for standing out professionally.

gray.title: Medium Gray
gray.description: Neutral and professional. Avoid very light gray which can wash out on camera.

jewel.title: Jewel Tones
jewel.description: Emerald, sapphire, ruby - rich colors that add depth and dimension on screen.

white.title: Pure White
white.description: Reflects too much light and can cause glare. Choose cream or light blue instead.

black.title: Pure Black
black.description: Can create a floating head effect. Dark navy or charcoal are better choices.

bright.title: Bright Red or Neon
bright.description: Can bleed or vibrate on camera. Stick to muted or jewel tones for reds.

patterns.title: Busy Patterns
patterns.description: Fine stripes, small checks, and herringbone can create a distracting moiré effect on screen.

women.title: For Women

formal.title: Formal Meetings
formal.item1: Solid-colored blouse in jewel tones or pastels
formal.item2: Structured blazer in navy, gray, or camel

casual.title: Casual Calls
casual.item1: Button-up shirt in solid color or subtle pattern
casual.item3: Statement earrings (on-camera only accessory that really shows)

women.tip: V-necks and scoop necks are more flattering on camera than crew necks. Add a blazer or cardigan for instant polish.

men.title: For Men

formal.title: Formal Meetings
formal.item1: Solid dress shirt in blue, white, or light purple
formal.item2: Tie (optional) - solid or subtle pattern only
formal.item3: Sport coat or suit jacket in navy or charcoal

casual.title: Casual Calls
casual.item1: Button-up shirt in solid or simple pattern
casual.item2: Quarter-zip or polo in rich colors
casual.item3: Casual blazer to elevate the look

men.tip: Button your top button and add a tie for high-stakes calls. For casual meetings, one button undone looks relaxed but professional.

lighting.title: Lighting
lighting.description: Good lighting is more important than a good camera.
lighting.tip1: Face a window for natural light (avoid backlighting)
lighting.tip2: Use a ring light or desk lamp at eye level
lighting.tip3: Avoid overhead lighting that creates shadows

background.title: Background
background.description: Your background should be clean and professional.
background.tip1: Solid wall or subtle bookshelf works best
background.tip3: Use virtual backgrounds sparingly (can look unprofessional)

camera.title: Camera Angle
camera.description: Position matters for a flattering appearance.
camera.tip1: Camera at eye level (stack books if needed)
camera.tip2: Sit 2-3 feet from camera for proper framing
camera.tip3: Look at the camera, not the screen, when speaking

mistake1.title: Wearing Pajamas on Bottom
mistake1.description: You never know when you'll need to stand up. Dress fully for confidence and unexpected moments.

mistake2.title: Too Much Jewelry
mistake2.description: Dangling earrings, noisy bracelets, and multiple necklaces are distracting on camera. Keep it simple.

mistake3.title: Not Testing Beforehand
mistake3.description: Always test your setup 5 minutes early. Check lighting, framing, and audio before the call starts.

mistake4.title: Forgetting the Collar
mistake4.description: Your collar is the most visible part of your outfit on camera. Make sure it's crisp, straight, and wrinkle-free.

cta.title: Camera-Ready Styles
cta.description: Discover our collection of video-call-perfect shirts and blouses in flattering solid colors.

interviewOutfit.title: Job Interview Outfit Guide
interviewOutfit.subtitle: Make a powerful first impression with the perfect interview outfit. Learn industry-specific guidelines and what to wear to land your dream job.

rule1.title: Dress One Level Up
rule1.description: Research the company dress code and dress one notch more formal. When in doubt, it's better to be slightly overdressed.

rule2.title: Fit is Everything
rule2.description: A perfectly fitted, simple outfit beats an expensive, ill-fitting one every time. Get alterations if needed.

rule3.title: Let Your Skills Shine
rule3.description: Your outfit should be professional but not distracting. The focus should be on you and your qualifications.

corporate.title: Corporate / Finance / Law
corporate.description: Traditional business formal is expected. This is where you pull out your most conservative, polished look.

women.title: Women
women.item2: White or light blue button-up blouse
women.item4: Minimal jewelry - stud earrings, simple necklace

men.title: Men
men.item2: White or light blue dress shirt

tech.title: Tech / Startup
tech.description: Business casual is typically appropriate. Show you understand the culture while still being professional.

women.title: Women
women.item2: Blouse or button-up in any color

men.title: Men
men.item4: Clean leather shoes or minimal sneakers

creative.title: Creative / Design / Marketing
creative.description: Show your personal style while staying professional. This is where you can express creativity through your outfit.

women.title: Women
women.item1: Stylish blouse in interesting color or pattern
women.item5: Your outfit can show your aesthetic

virtual.title: Virtual Interview Considerations
virtual.description: Video interviews have different requirements than in-person meetings.

tips.tip1: Choose solid colors that contrast with your background
tips.tip2: Avoid white (causes glare) and busy patterns (distracting on camera)
tips.tip3: Focus on from the waist up - that's all they'll see
tips.tip4: Test your outfit on camera 1 day before
tips.tip5: Good lighting can make a bigger difference than expensive clothes
tips.tip6: Dress fully anyway - it affects your confidence and body language

nightBefore.title: The Night Before
nightBefore.item1: Lay out your complete outfit including accessories
nightBefore.item2: Check for wrinkles, stains, loose threads, missing buttons
nightBefore.item4: Polish shoes and check they're scuff-free
nightBefore.item5: Try on the full outfit to verify fit and comfort
nightBefore.item6: Prepare a backup outfit just in case

morning.title: Interview Morning
morning.item1: Get dressed 30 minutes before leaving (avoid last-minute stress)
morning.item2: Check yourself from all angles in a full-length mirror
morning.item3: Verify tags are removed and nothing is tucked wrong
morning.item4: Bring lint roller for final touch-ups

mistake1.title: Too Trendy or Casual
mistake1.description: Even at casual companies, an interview is a formal occasion. Save the ripped jeans and graphic tees.

mistake2.title: Uncomfortable or Ill-Fitting
mistake2.description: If you're tugging at your collar or adjusting your waistband, it shows. Wear something you can sit comfortably in for hours.

mistake3.title: Too Much Fragrance
mistake3.description: Strong perfumes or colognes can be overwhelming in small interview rooms and may trigger allergies.

mistake4.title: Distracting Accessories
mistake4.description: Noisy bracelets, flashy watches, or excessive jewelry takes attention away from what you're saying.

mistake5.title: Wearing Something Brand New
mistake5.description: New clothes can be stiff, uncomfortable, or surprise you with issues. Wear something you've tested before.

mistake6.title: Ignoring the Details
mistake6.description: Scuffed shoes, visible tags, wrinkled collar, or chipped nail polish suggest you don't pay attention to details.

cta.title: Interview-Ready Wardrobe
cta.description: Build your professional interview wardrobe with our collection of perfectly tailored shirts and blouses.
